assemblage.title: Function Operations
assemblage.p:
Let f be a function with domain A and g be a function with domain B.
Addition/Subtraction: h(x) = (f\pm g)(x) = f(x)\pm g(x). The domain of h(x) is A\cap B.
Multiplication: j(x) = (fg)(x) = f(x)\cdot g(x). The domain of j is A\cap B.
Division: k(x) = \lrpar{\dfrac{f}{g}}(x) = \dfrac{f(x)}{g(x)}, provided that g(x)\neq 0. The domain of k(x) is \lrbrace{x\in A\cap B\mid g(x)\neq 0}

assemblage.title: Function Composition
assemblage.p: Given two function f and g, the composite function f\circ g is defined by (f\circ g)(x) = f(g(x)).
The domain of f\circ g is the set of all x in the domain of g such that g(x) is in the domain of f.

ol.label: a
ol.li: The domain is (-\infty,-2)\cup (-2,\infty). The function can decompose as f(x) = a(b(x)), where a(x) = \dfrac{1}{x}, b(x) = x+2
The domain is (-\infty,\infty). The function can decompose as q(x) = a(b(x)), where a(x) = x^5, b(x) = 2x+1
The domain is (-\infty,0)\cup (0,\infty). The function can decompose as s(h)) = a(b(h)), where a(h) = \sin h, b(h) = 5h^2 + \dfrac{1}{h}
The domain is \lrpar{-\infty, \sqrt[5]{\dfrac{-1.7}{2}}}\cup \lrpar{\sqrt[5]{\dfrac{-1.7}{2}},\infty}. The function can decompose as y(r) = a(b(r)), where a(r) = \dfrac{5.317}{r^2}, b(x) = 2r^5+1.7
The domain is x\neq \sqrt{\dfrac{\pi}{2}+\pi k}, where k\in\Z. The function can decompose as g(x) = a(b(x)), where a(x) = \tan x, b(x) = x^2
